content.description: Both axes range from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. Both the ellipse and the hyperbola are centered at the origin.
content.question: The ellipse intersects its vertical line of symmetry at (0 comma negative 3) and (0 comma 3). The ellipse intersects its horizontal line of symmetry at (negative 2 comma 0) and (2 comma 0). The hyperbola opens left and right. The hyperbola has vertices at (negative 2 comma 0 and (2 comma 0). The left portion of the hyperbola passes through approximately (negative 4 comma 5.2) and (negative 4 comma negative 5.2). The right portion of the hyperbola passes through approximately (4 comma 5.2) and (4 comma negative 5.2). The figure shows the graphs of the ellipse <math alttext="x squared over a squared plus y squared over b squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and the hyperbola <math alttext="x squared over a squared minus y squared over b squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the same <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. Which of the following are equations of the asymptotes of the hyperbola?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals negative 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y equals 2 over 3 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="y equals negative 2 over 3 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y equals 2 over 3 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="y equals 2 over 3 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y equals 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="y equals negative 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y equals 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals negative 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y equals 3 over 2 x"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
